constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 126 (Thursday, July 28, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. GIBBS:
H.R. 8564.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 18, that grants Congress the
power to make all laws necessary and proper for carrying out
the powers vested by Congress in the Constitution of the
United States or in any department or officer thereof.
[Page H7406]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

title: Port Automation Improvement Act of 2022
